review: The AppleTV is a great product that essentially allowed us to cancel our cable service and now we watch 100% of our shows through AppleTV.  We utilize the Netflix app as well as occasionally purchasing content directly from iTunes through the AppleTV (mostly movies) and use the Airplay mirroring to stream live TV shows from various websites mirrored directly from our iPad.  The Airplay mirroring is a HUGE feature which has really made the AppleTV an indispensable product for us.  Netflix works well on the AppleTV, we used the Wii prior to purchasing the AppleTV and the interface and quality of streaming seems to be better on the AppleTV.AppleTV is highly integrated to work well with other Apple products and the iphone has a great free app which you can use to improve over the sleek remote that comes with it.  The nice small simple remote is great for going to quick places but when you start wanting to type, etc., an app like the remote app on the iphone is much more handy.  You can also pair a bluetooth keyboard to make typing even easier, but I haven't really needed that so much.You can also select Apples new internet radio station to play background music and if you have another Apple computer hooked up to the network it will also show a screensaver with your recent pictures scrolling from the photostream.Overall, this is a great product and has more than paid for itself in our ability to cancel our cable service.  The features such as Airplay are amazing and allow you to stream things from your iPad to the extent that you couldn't tell that you weren't watching the actual TV shows on cable.
author: Michael

review: Pros: It is crystal clear compared to my BluRay player's similar apps (Netflix, Hulu, etc)Cons: The remote is difficult to use for typing.For the most part, I am very pleased with this product. It is far better than the apps I was using on my BluRay player to accomplish the same things. The addition of the Watch ESPN app is a great feature that I can't wait to use this football season (requires a subscription).The one thing I don't like is typing with the tiny remote control. My email address is rather long, as are all my passwords, making signing in to apps very cumbersome with this remote. The navigation is slightly difficult with the toggle button on the remote (my large thumb sometimes activates the wrong side of the switch). But this is definitely not a deal breaker for me. It would be great if I could connect my wireless keyboard to it for sign in purposes and searching.Overall, I very highly recommend this product. It's another example of a long line of Apple products that are clearly ahead of the game.
